questions.question_text:
Your company is exploring the use of voice recognition technologies in its smart home devices. The company wants to identify any barriers that might unintentionally leave out specific user groups.

This is an example of which Microsoft guiding principle for responsible AI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Fairness is indeed another crucial AI principle that addresses bias and ensures equitable treatment of all users. While Inclusiveness focuses on accessibility and usability for diverse user groups, Fairness ensures that AI systems do not discriminate against any individuals or groups.

Because it says user groups the answer is D - Inclusiveness

Selected Answer: D
Inclusiveness - based on

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/2-consider-the-fairness-principle

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/5-apply-the-inclusiveness-principle

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a large dataset that contains motor vehicle sales data.

You need to train an automated machine learning (automated ML) model to predict vehicle sale values based on the type of vehicle.

Which task should you select? To answer, select the appropriate task in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
1. "Values" -> Regression
2. Choose column -> Configuration
3. All column data -> No needs featurization
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-automated-ml-for-ml-models?view=azureml-api-2
On exam 27 jul 2023 - regression is correct
Regression, always where is a number its a regression

comments.content:
Hey... Examtopics put some wrong answers "on purpose", to be able to continue operating, being considered a "fan page", with right and wrong questions. If all the questions were right, MSFT and other companies would have the right to put them down, as it would be ilegal to have the exact same questions with all the right answers from official exams.

So, this being said, it's fundamental for us to ALWAYS check the Comment section of each question, to see the discussion between the members. Here you'll find the most probable right answers, discussed between the community. That's a percentage of assurance ~99% for the most of the questions, it's not perfect, but it's better than have to shut down the site, got it? :)

discussion.content: I want my money back for this exam. Too many wrong answers. The answer is confusion matrix

comments.content: You learn the most from wrong answers. Look up the discussion and remember why an answer was wrong and why the right answer was the correct one.

discussion.content: The answer is confusion matrix. The given answer of threshold is wrong.

Form Recognizer is now Azure AI Document Intelligence!
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0

Selected Answer: B
b is correct

Selected Answer: B
Answer is indeed Form Recognizer, but the name is changed to Document Intelligence
